intro: Kedrostis gijef, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which can be toxic. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, with lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
